p:
DPPH free radical scavenging activity of the date extracts were determined by the method of Brand-Williams et al. (1995) [ 35]. Aliquots (50 μl) of serially diluted (500–0.98 μg/mL) extract solutions in methanol were mixed with 5 mL of DPPH solution (40 μg/mL) in methanol. The reaction mixture was vortexed thoroughly and left in the dark at room temperature for 30 min. Then the absorbance of the mixture was measured at 517 nm in a UV spectrophotometer (Shimadzu 2000). Ascorbic acid was used as positive control and percent inhibition was calculated using the following equation:
% ⋅ Inhibition ⋅ = ⋅
[
1 − ⋅
(
Abs sample
⋅ / ⋅
Abs control
)
]
⋅ × ⋅ 100 ⋅ %
where Abs sample is the absorbance of the extract/standard solution in methanol while Abs control is the absorbance of the DPPH solution in methanol.
